children.text: Not caring is easy. Because instead of doing the hard work of finding (and embracing) workarounds to problems, you can simply tune it off.
Caring, on the other hand, whether about a people or a problem (or a solution), is difficult.
Because it forces you to sacrifice the sinecure of not caring, of simply letting things be.
Caring takes work. And time. And patience. And opportunity. Sometimes it takes money. And it takes quite a lot of concern.
